France, officially known as the French Republic, is one of the world’s most influential nations in terms of culture, politics, and economics. Known for its revolutionary history, philosophical legacy, and cultural richness, France has played a pivotal role in shaping modern Western civilization.
Paris, the capital and largest city, is globally recognized for its art, fashion, gastronomy, and landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, and Notre-Dame Cathedral. Other notable cities include Lyon, Marseille, Bordeaux, and Nice, each offering unique regional charm and history.
France is a semi-presidential republic with both a President and a Prime Minister. Its government includes a bicameral parliament consisting of the National Assembly and the Senate. The President serves as the head of state, while the Prime Minister leads the government.
Geographically, France boasts a wide array of landscapes—from the snow-capped Alps and Pyrenees to the fertile plains of the Loire Valley and the sun-drenched French Riviera. The country enjoys a temperate climate overall, with variations depending on the region, including oceanic, continental, and Mediterranean climates.
